Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2006012799.CaseDesc: John Crofts last resided in a retirement home on Yearly Road in Huntsville. He was last seen in the Huntsville area on December 25, 1997.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake. It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded. The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014003382.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1988, Mr. Umpherville and a friend were driving to The Pas where they stayed the night. In the morning the two departed The Pas via 20 foot yawl with the intent on going to Easterville. They departed the Umpherville settlement around 1300hrs and they briefly stopped at Pine Bluff around 1600 hrs. It is believed they then stopped at a friends trappers cabin at Rat Hunting and ate a meal. The last thing the survivor remembers, is seeing the lights of Easterville and he crawled to the front of the boat where he fell asleep. He awoke around 0500 hrs the next day and Mr. Umpherville was no longer in the boat and he was adrift. Numerous islands in the area were searched, shorelines were searched and several air and water patrols were made without success. Mr. Umpherville has not been located and his whereabouts is unknown.

Hat: Grey, baseball style with "Hi Ho Hi Ho" on front

Case reference: 2012020123.CaseDesc: Paul Côté left his residence on June 13th 2000 and hasn’t been seen since. His car was located a few days later, on June 18th 2000, in a commercial parking lot in the city of Rimouski.

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand

Case reference: 2006000699.CaseDesc:
On January 31, 1988, a male was found on the Don Valley Parkway, having jumped from the Bloor Street Viaduct in Toronto. He is described as a dark-skinned Caucasian. His post-mortem length was recorded as being approximately 5’5"-5'6", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living length due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has a thick beard and moustache. He also has a significant amount of body hair. His appendix is present.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Thick receding hairline, bushy eyebrows
Teeth: Full set of natural teeth: exception of third molars. Amalgam fillings in some post. teeth, U-left lateral incisor is peg-shaped
Jacket: Leather, Brown, "House of Peerless" Winnepeg, Canada brand, size large,
Shirt: Long-sleeve salmon-coloured shirt with vertical blue stripes
Shoes: Grey leather shoes with rubber crepe soles
Underwear: Green, White band, "Watsons" brand, size large
Mark: Left Cheek, Large nevus (mole) on the left side of his face beside his nose.

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2008015999.CaseDesc: John Zuern was 21 years old when he went missing from the London Psychiatric Hospital in London, Ontario on June 14, 1975.  He did not return to his family home in Guelph, Ontario, and was reported missing by his family. He had been diagnosed as schizophrenic, and he walks with a pronounced limp.  Mr. Zuern's brother reported seeing him in the Bloor & Spadina area of Toronto during the summer of 1980.  He was believed to have been living on the streets at that time.

Hair: Grey, Long, Unkempt; unkempt Beard, Moustache
Deformity: leg, walks with a pronounced limp

Case reference: 2013000143.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2013, Delvin D'Arcy's wife contacted the Fraser Lake RCMP to report her husband as missing. She advised them that Delvin was staying in Fort Fraser while working in the area. Delvin had contacted her on a regular basis but she has not heard from him since Feb 13, 2013.  It is believed that Mr. D'Arcy may be traveling to Ontario but he has not been heard of or seen since.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Salt and pepper grey

Case reference: 2015068386.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2015, the remains of a newborn baby boy were found on the grounds of the Free Church of Scotland in Mount Albion, Prince Edward Island.  The body was found wrapped in a towel with a green frog embroidered on it.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2012020032.CaseDesc: Lorilee Francis was last known to be in Grande Prairie, Alberta. She has not been heard from by family or friends since approximately October of 2007.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Francis Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Francis had left his home with two other men.

Coat: Dark Blue, Blazer, McGill University crest on the pocket

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville. He was living in Longueuil. He left in his vehicle. His vehicle was found September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2016045557.CaseDesc: In January 2015, Warner Huckerby was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018026641.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1991, the body of an adult Asian male was found in the Burrard Inlet, British Columbia. He was slim and healthy, with no tattoos and his teeth were in good condition. It is believed he was deceased for only one or two days prior to his body being recovered.

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2018063446.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1990, Ian MacKay was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Ian’s brother had not heard from him in three years before he reported him missing.

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2005006299.CaseDesc:
On June 16 1977, the body of a male was recovered from the Niagara River at the Canadian Niagara Power House above the Niagara Falls. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 200-210 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix is present and he may have suffered from high blood pressure, diabetes and/or alcoholism. He may have also suffered from pancreatitis in the past. He is thought to have been in the water for approximately 1 to 2 months.

Teeth: Partial acrylic denture:upper incisors and some premolars. Lost all lower molars and lower right 2nd premolar prior to death.
Shirt: Plaid shirt, blue and cream coloured

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7th, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Mr. Do had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021035166.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2021, Nicole Frenchman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Nicole was living with her friends, but had no fixed address. Nicole was normally very active on social media but has not accessed it since her disappearance.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Leopard print
Right Side Of Neck, Red kiss lips
Right Hand, "Queen dubs dollar sign" on the middle finger
Right Forearm, Dreamcatcher; feathers; "Trust no one"
Pierce: Upper Lip, Monroe piercing on left side

Case reference: 2014004301.CaseDesc: Zolton Zambory was reported missing by his estranged wife on January 24, 1965. On January 30, 1965, Vancouver City Police located his vehicle abandoned in Vancouver. His vehicle was unlocked with his personal belongings left behind. He emigrated from Germany and arrived in Quebec on May, 1957.

Case reference: 2014005268.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2009, Harold Dorion was reported missing to the Nelson House RCMP. Investigation later identified that Mr. Dorion was last seen the last week of July 2007. Since that time, Mr. Dorion has not been seen or heard of. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002286.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1980, Guy Fortier was seen for the last time as he left his residence, without saying where he was going, in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Guy was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2012020100.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2006, the remains of a Caucasian woman were discovered in an old well in Saskatoon, SK.  Her remains appear to have been there for many decades.  There are injuries on the remains that suggest she may have been a victim of foul play.

Skirt: Cotton, Black, White, poplin skirt, ruffled edge with silk bodice
Underwear: Cotton, White, pre-1920 corset with stays
Boots: Leather, Black, ladies-front lace up pointed toe, circa 1910

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2010002299.CaseDesc: Susan Gourley was last seen in late November of 2001, by a friend, in the area of Barton Street and Stirton Avenue, in downtown Hamilton.  She was reported missing by her mother February 28th, 2002.

Case reference: 2014004498.CaseDesc: Guillermina Coleman left her residence in the Cypress View Foundation between 8:00 p.m. on July 4, and 10:00 a.m. on July 5, 2004. Mrs. Coleman was despondent, and was released from the hospital only a few days before she was last seen. Mrs. Coleman was only able to walk for short distances.

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2014001166.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2005 a man entered the Royal Victoria Hospital. He identified himself verbally as John Boudreau or Boudreault with the date of birth 1943-09-23, to the hospital attendants. No proof of identity could be made. The man was homeless but not known to local organizations.

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Mr. Allen.

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016024223.CaseDesc: Joseph Amiro was last seen leaving the Queen Elizabeth II Health Sciences Centre in Halifax, Nova Scotia on May 1, 2016.  Mr. Amiro suffers from medical issues that require daily medication. He is known to wear glasses and walk with a cane. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020106.CaseDesc: Danielle Boisvert, 18 years old, disappeared November 6, 1979. On that day, Danielle was last seen leaving a bar in Montreal-North, Québec.

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2014001228.CaseDesc: On June 6, 2004, the remains of a man were recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta.  There was dental work present.

Case reference: 2021016411.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006007599.CaseDesc: Leland Iseler was last seen October 9, 1967, at a hunt camp on the Mattagami River,  near Cypress Falls, 30 miles north of Smooth Rock Falls.  His boat was found anchored about 100 feet off shore and his fishing rod was missing. Leland Iseler has never been located.

Case reference: 2016068411.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the body of a male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 35 years old, was found on the Lake Erie Country Club beach, Malden Township, Essex County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he had been in the water for 5-7 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and he may have worn a lower denture.
Underwear: White, "Fruit of the Loom" brand, size 30

Case reference: 2014003900.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1977 at approximately 3 p.m., Ronald Foucault left his father’s business located in the city of Blainville, Quebec and told his father he had to travel to Texas, in the United States for work. There has been no news from Ronald since this time and it is impossible to confirm his arrival in the United States. In 1979, some of his belongings were found near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last heard from by her family sometime between 1968 and 1972. She was living in Edmonton, but is thought to have possibly gone to Vancouver during this time.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2016068159.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1968, the skeletonized remains of what is believed to be a male individual was found on the Georgian Bay shoreline in Culvert's Dump, 6 miles southeast of Tobermory, Bruce County. The appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for no less than 2 years before discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Evidence of tooth extraction; it is possible that this individual wore a partial upper denture.
Pants: Charcoal grey or black synthetic material was recovered from the body at the waist region.
Belt: Leather, size 40; markings on belt read "Top Grain Steerhide Bridle 91299"

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: Trevor Angell was last heard from on September 22, 2000. Mr. Angell is a truck driver who was taking a load from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located on September 25, 2000 in Primm, Nevada, USA.

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014005230.CaseDesc: On March 9, 2009, Daniel Moisan was last seen leaving a residence in Victoriaville to go to an acquaintance’s house. Daniel has not been seen since.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Orange, Brand: Harley Davidson

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2009003999.CaseDesc: At about 1 p.m. Robert Aho of North Bay left Land O’Lakes Cottages located in Martin River and headed west bound on Highway 64 towards Field. He was carrying a packsack and duffle bag and has not been in contact with his family since.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeved, Toronto Maple Leaf

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2012749001.CaseDesc: Lonnie Boudreau was last seen in the city of Ottawa in February 1981. He has not been heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Short, Straight, parted from left to right
Teeth: Good, Small gap between the two front teeth
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Beauty mark

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, SK. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Mr. Whitehead.

Tattoo: Skull with hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bar
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig was seen for the last time as he left his work site at the Bow Valley Provincial Park in Canmore, Alberta. At this time, Edward was on his way to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park in Alberta. His boat was found empty floating on the lake. During the time of his disappearance, Edward was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020176.CaseDesc: This adult male was found in Vancouver rooming house.

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2014033444.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 2, 1979, Michel Pelletier, and his older sister, were seen for the last time playing in their relatives’ backyard in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On July 13, 1979, the body of Michel’s sister was found in the St-Lawrence River, however he has not been found.

Case reference: 2006022399.CaseDesc: Jocelyn "Josh" Blais was last seen in a bait shop in Ignace, Ontario. He and a friend were headed to Cecil Lake (24 kilometres north of Ignace and 1 kilometre east off Hwy. 599) for a day of fishing. His overturned boat was later discovered.

Case reference: 2006020399.CaseDesc: Lawrence Prettie was last seen on October 23, 1994. His boat capsized on Lac Seul and he is presumed drowned. His body has never been recovered.  His boat, camping and fishing gear were located strewn about on an island in Lac Seul.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2020011412.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1985, at approximately 11:00pm, Tahiya Shiekh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Tahiya had been having ongoing disputes with her parents.

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014005164.CaseDesc: Anne Peters was reported missing in October 2008 after she had not been heard from for a month. Anne was a street trade worker and had a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014006123.CaseDesc: Michael Montgomery was last seen at his residence in Mississauga, Ontario on May 22, 2013. At the end of May 2013 Mr. Montgomery was spotted in the area of HWY 16, Jasper National Park, Alberta. It is possible that he was making his way towards Edmonton to look for work.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2021015408.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2021, Ziyue "Moses" LIU was reported missing from his family home in Surrey, British Columbia. On April 19, 2021, Moses was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia. He may or may not be wearing glasses.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles, slip on

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm , "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snow machine on the North Saskatchewan river near Prince Albert, SK. His snow machine went through open ice and searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate his body.

Pants: Black, snowmobile; possible yellow stripe down the sides
Scar: Left Hand, 1.5 cm scar on back of 2nd and 3rd finger
Left Wrist, 2 cm scar on the back of the wrist
